intro: Sarcostemma gardneri, commonly known as the Indian milkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asclepiadaceae. It is native to India and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that are followed by distinctive, follicle-like fruits. It is often found in dry, rocky areas and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions. Sarcostemma gardneri is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
